segments.text: hey , Maris , are you a part-timer ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: part-timer ? Is that a new buzzword ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: oh , it ’ s pretty popular among my classmates these days . So are you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: sure , I have a part-time job as a bartender .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: cool ! It must be amazing to work at a bar !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yeah , but I ’ m not there for fun . I have to remain professional and if I get distracted , the manager would be pretty upset .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that ’ s true . I ’ m wondering did you learn anything from the job ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: of course . There ’ s always much to learn . I got to know more about the real world .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you mean you got working experience , right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: not just working experience . I would say the biggest lesson I learned is how to deal with people from all walks of life .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: sometimes it is . But after working for a few weeks , it ’ s easy to figure out .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: maybe you can come to the bar one day and I ’ ll show you around .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: great . I ’ m looking forward to it .
segments.speaker: S1
